column4: Anyone have any thoughts on the problem I mentioned up above?
i dont see any text, whats up?
is it a similar drive?
you dont need to be, is it the same model and size?
well done you are now expert enough
ok, have you had this thing in a windows machine
did you unplug it gracefully?
id do it again, make sure you use the remove device thingy in windows
ok, well try there and if its still no good run mount in terminal, you should see the mountings, one will look like your stick
can you write as root?
then its mounted without user writing, it needs remounting
can you please direct your speech, http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-405396.html
you may want to try dosfsck -a /dev/sdb1
thank you so much!
please direct you r speech, yours gets lost in this sea of names
all groovy now?
sorry.
you can tab complete the names, just like you do in terminal
Oh! Tab-complete is wonderful. And it's working! I'll just make sure it still works in Windows now...
Thanks for all your help!
np
just remember to do a proper removal and you win
